more_info.origin: Calcium salt of ascorbic acid (vitamin C, a n atural acid), which occurs naturally in most fruits and vegetables. Commercially synthesised by bacterial fermentation of glucose, followed by chemical oxidation.
more_info.characteristics: Anti-oxidant and bread enhancer. It prevents browning of fruits as well as formation of nitrosamines in meat. Ascorbic acid is vitamin C; however, it cannot be added as a vitamin supplement when labelled E302.
more_info.side_effects: No side effects known in the concentrations used.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: ascorbic acid and ascorbates can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.
